November 22, 2013 marks the 50th anniversary of the tragedy that has haunted America ever since. For the first time, this concise and compelling book pierces the veil of secrecy to fully document the small, tightly-held conspiracy that killed President John F. Kennedy. It explains why he was murdered, and how it was done in a way that forced many records to remain secret for almost fifty years.

The Hidden History of JFKÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Assassination draws on exclusive interviews with more than two dozen associates of John and Robert Kennedy, in addition to former FBI, Secret Service, military intelligence, and Congressional personnel, who provided critical first-hand information. The book also uses government filesÃ¢â‚¬â€including the detailed FBI confession of notorious Mafia godfather Carlos MarcelloÃ¢â‚¬â€to simply and clearly reveal exactly who killed JFK. Using information never published before, the book uses MarcelloÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own words to his closest associates to describe the plot. His confession is also backed up by a wealth of independent documentation.

Some of the bookÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s revelations will be dramatized in the upcoming Warner Brothers film Legacy of Secrecy, produced by and starring Leonardo DiCaprio, which also stars Robert De Niro as Carlos Marcello.

The Hidden History of JFKÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Assassination is the definitive account of the crime and the secrecy which has surrounded it.
